title: What is this telling me anything? Form A Spcialist for suport riot. By Jenny771
body:
Hello LegendaryYangY,

Your account has received a 2 week suspension due to intentionally feeding which resulted in a negative experience for players.

We know League of Legends can be frustrating at times, but there is never an excuse for purposely ruining the game for others.

Keep in mind we will be tracking your behavior in the future and inability to change can result in a permanent suspension.

Jenny711
Player Support Specialist
"Let my blade speak the law&quot

How is this telling me anything? DId you look into details like i ask ? How rude calling people inability? blake speak the law ? i thought this game is open for everyone when they arent good.

replies.body:
You got hit by FeederBuster.

>How rude calling people inability?

They meant "if you are unable to change". They were not suggesting a disability.

http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-history/NA1/221406641

Show me where this player intentionally fed.

Keep in mind that your link only shows the past ranked games the player has played (at least it does for me), with the most recent being nearly 2 weeks ago. If you look at his op.gg, the most recent match played is a normal played 2 days ago where he goes 1/20/0 as Galio in a near 40 minute game, which means on average, he died about once every 2 minutes. He earned less gold than anyone on his team, only earning a little over 200 gold than the _enemy_ support, and also had the least amount of CS out of any non-support laner in the game, barely beating his own jungler by 9 CS, who had a much higher kill participation. To me, this game doesn't look to good for the OP.

Now, I'm not saying that the OP did indeed intentionally feed in this game, but I'd be willing to be it is the game that triggered the ban. If I'm not mistaken, though, I do believe intentional feeding punishments come with an in-client reform card with a link to the game that triggered the punishment. If he didn't get one, then he should definitely ask support for the match where he was intentionally feeding.

Mmm I'm looking at that 1-20 game. It's his 3rd Galio game ever, in Normals:

He has more damage than his midlaner,
He took more damage than his midlaner/adc,
He placed more wards than his midlaner/adc,
He has more CS than his jungler,
But he earned the least amount of gold,
And had the lowest XP level,
And no assists, 1 kill and 20 deaths

It's _very likely_ he was split psuhing all the time and the enemy Quinn (top laner) and/or Zed (midlaner) were heavily focusing him down before any fight. He's bought items and just seems to be _really bad_ at itemization and galio overall.

http://www.lolking.net/summoner/na/59874222/LegendaryYangY#matches gives more context, including item purchases throughout the game etc.

I'm trying to find the one website that shows where a player died/made kills, to see if it supports my theory of him splitpushing only and getting focused.

It is also possible he was continuing to run at them and intentionally feed. If we had a spectate copy of the game it would help to solve the OP's issue.
I was gonna say http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2404298804/221406641?tab=overview , but on a second thought that's actually a regular Yasuo KDA.
I didnt feed every games i play so far... get ban for 14 days lol.....

Hey if you'd like I can watch your game replay from your Galio 1-20 normals game, in order to better determine what caused Riot to ban you.

If so, you'll need to upload a copy of the .rofl replay file; You can download replays to your computer by going into the client, then click **Profile > Match History > Download match button (right side)**. It should download a .rofl file which is pretty small, so it should be easy to upload and share the link.

I recommend you continue replying with your support ticket(s) and ask Riot to show which games where you were "intentionally feeding".

The burden of proof is on them to provide evidence that you are guilty of intentionally feeding.

Impossible to say as riot makes the rules
but 6/20/1 in 38 mins means a death less than 2mins
2/16/6 in 27 mins, same

sounds a tad high for a bad game
but again only op and riot knows the truth

Just a thought

the one where he went 6-20 also has the ADC going 3-15, so it's not a valid indicator of "intent to feed".

2-16 isn't, either.

Unfortunately the burden of proof to show this player was in fact _intentionally_ feeding, is on Riot, and we know they don't like to prove themselves in these types of cases (where only they know the 'truth'),

Your account has received a 2 week suspension due to intentionally feeding which resulted in a negative experience for players.

appears to be what they are telling you
